Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL LOCATION, BEST SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: maraboscolo
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location both for business and leisure travellers.Very close to sightseeings and to metro station, silent and calm property although centrally located. Very easy to reach from airport with metro. Best service, very friendly employees.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: CristinaSPaulo
Reviews.Content: I was in Madrid for more than a week, including a working and vacation period, so I stayed in the hotel for ten days. The staff is great and all the services provided were great. Rooms are really spacious, excellent bed. Shower is very good but it was hard to open it in my first days, it was fixed but reveals that there are some basic infrastructure issues that should be dealt with or maybe become a hazard in the long run: in particular, as many reviews have mentioned the carpet in the room is sure to be a low point, it is old, and it should be either removed or changed. TV also does not have many options in English channells, and there is a limited offer of sports and movies channel. Location is great, near both metro stations (Plaza de Espana and Ventura Rodrigues) and within a walking distance from many restaurants, movie theaters, fast food options and a supermaket located in Calle Princesa, inside the El Corte Ingles. It is just a 5-10 minute walk and the store is complete, including, added to market, food court, clothes, supplies and so on. Also, if you feell like walking you can reach the major attractions in Madrid from there, including the Gran Via, Plaza Mayor, Debod Temple, it is 15-30min uphill, but not that difficult. In the morning, I had breakfast at the hotel, the buffet, and options are quite good. Although you have several options outside, it is much more confortable to eat inside, in particular if you have to leave early in the morning (and things in Madrid tend to open after 8-9am). It is not worth the trouble even for the price, since the hotel offers three choices, buffet or two fast meals which are cheaper. I would definitly stay here again, but the hotel should be more attentive to the carpet issue and some other maintainance things regarding the air conditiong (it works, but, I for instance, like it cooler than I managed to get).

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: MONNA22
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 days in this hotel and it was really great. The rooms are spacious, clean and the bed is very confortable. Also the location is great. Just 2 minutes from Plaza de Espana metro station and 3 other metro stations. Plenty if buses around but the best is that you can walk to most turist places. Overall great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “flying visit for good price and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Martyn W
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nicely located near the metro station which meant walking was about 500m. (on the downside it was not on a direct line from the airport which meant I needed to change but the Madrid Metro network is efficient). I booked months in advance so got a good price. My room had a balcony although not a magnificent view it was still nice to have. The lifts were old fashioned but I suppose that adds something different to the hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful. If going to Madrid I would stay at this hotel again at the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice at the center of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very good choice at the center of Madrid. Well located (walking distance to the main attractions), with public transport (subway and bus) just at the corner of the hotel, pleasant staff (good english speaking), and very clean hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel for turism in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Spain 2012”
Reviews.Author: KkFiff
Reviews.Content: Hotel bed was large, very comfortable and staff was excellent. It was near everything we needed and I would recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “ANOTHER GREAT STAY....BUT MERCURE PLEASE RENOVATE”
Reviews.Author: ICE-MOH
Reviews.Content: Another Great Stay at this hotel. I always stay at this hotel whenever I am in Madrid. For the past 11 years, since this hotel was a Sofitel property, it has always been a gem. The staff is absolutely WONDERFUL, especially, the front desk staff. This is a centrally located hotel with access to downtown madrid, metro and bus stations. the service is great and the staff are extremely helpful. However, I believe it is about time to renovate this great property. Thank you very much Accor.

Reviews.Title: “Average and not central enough”
Reviews.Author: NewcastleJohnners
Reviews.Content: Not really in a great location but booked too late. Needs a complete renovation without a doubt. Chains such as Accor have the money to do this. There are better options which are cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Staff came around and saved the review”
Reviews.Author: Bruno-DF
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel about 2 months before going to Madrid. At that time I had requested a non-carpeted room, for my wife is allergic to it. Upon checking-in the manager said they had no hardwood floored rooms and implied I should have called them bedore arriving there. I believe they are the ones that should've contacted me right after seeing my request during the reservation procedures. After much reasoning, they offered us to go to another Mercure nearby for an extra 30euros. Since we were tired and had a commitment to attend to, we decided to try staying at the hotel for that particular night. The hotel is very old and it shows in the room: old closets, stained walls, etc. The following morning we decided to leave the hotel and check into the Mercure Santo Domingo. Even though I strongly believe the hotel should have told me my request wasn't going to be met, the fact that the front desk management taking the initiative to call the other hotel and trying to fit us in was very nice. It would have been perfect if the hotel offered a cab ride to the otther location. But that didn't happen so we ended up carrying our luggage in a 8-10 minute walk along Gran Vía.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great place to stay to see all Madrid has to offer”
Reviews.Author: Chris71Ottawa
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a room with a balcony on the 6th floor and it was great. We really enjoyed this hotel as it is close to everything you could possibly want to be close to in Madrid. Positives: 1. Location. Sandwiched between two metro stops, plaza de espana and Ventura Rodriguez. 2. Easy to get to by metro from the airport. Take pink line to nuevos ministerios and transfer to line 10 to plaza de espana. This journey takes between 30-40 minutes but is so easy. 3. Metro. When you arrive at the airport you can buy a 5 day pass for 25 euro. 4. Room was a great size for the price in Europe. The balcony was a bonus. 5. We did not eat breakfast in the hotel as there is a bunch of places like Starbucks and te y cafe located 1 minute away by foot in a nice office tower square. Also a McDonald's and burger king in the same square as well as a few tapas places. 6. Staff were friendly and provided some helpful tips - I.e. go to mercado de San Miguel for a great experience near plaza del sol. And if you want to go to the bull fighting in plaza del toros just go buy your tickets on the day of the event. 7. Best toilet paper I've ever used in a hotel ever and that says a lot given it is in Europe! 8. 12:00 check out. Not so positive 9. There is no kettle in the room if you like to make tea or coffee, but we were ok with starbucks nearby. 10. We did not eat breakfast here, mostly due to one of our travelers need for non gluten food items. It is typical European style and not really what we look for in a breakfast but the food on display did look good. Overall: Madrid was one of the best cities we've visited in Europe this year. And our stay at the mercure was perfect as a base to explore all this wonderful city Has to offer. Just ask or a map and explore.

Reviews.Title: “Mercure Madrid - good value with some great qualities”
Reviews.Author: deathracer
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Mercure Madrid Plaza de Espana for 3 nights recently. The hotel is old style but maintained quite well. Old style, how so? - Old fashioned elevators (2) - Lobby is a bit on the darker side - Cool antique looking fixtures in the bathroom What we liked: - Room bed: was super comfortable with premium linens and great pillows - Room sound proofness: Very quiet. Heavy door with innner hallway and second inner door. We never heard anyone. - Room security: Excellent secure lock on door. The safe was the largest I've ever seen and I could fit my laptop in it easily. - Cleanliness: Very clean - Heating / AirCon / Water temp and pressure: All good - Breakfast: Excellent variety of food choices including fresh cut fruit, yoghurts, whole wheat bread, capuccinos. Best part, staff kept restocking the food....even asking us if we wanted anything else at 11am when the breakfast ends. - Location: excellent To improve: - Breakfast: oddly they charge extra (2 Euro) for eggs - suggest they could include eggs in the price, as the baccon and other hot items are included. - Front desk staff: Sometimes seemed to look a bit surly, but once you engaged them in conversation, they seemed to warm up and then they seemed friendly. - When a renovation is planned, lighter color choices in the lobby would help. Conclusion: - Excellent value while satisfying our most important considerations 1) Excellent sleep quality in a super quiet room 2) Great breakfast Note: They stored (for free) a considerable amount of our luggage while we hiked the Camino de Santiago.

Reviews.Title: “Good comfort”
Reviews.Author: Luxotraveller
Reviews.Content: Finding a decent hotel in Madrid is difficult, and I first came to this hotel when it was a Sofitel and for a very high price in an overcrowded situation. At that point I was rather disappointed, but since it was converted to a Mercure, and I have been able to book it for around 100 euros a night, I am quite pleased, and it is always my first choice for Madrid stays. Beds are very comfortable, rooms decorated in a style which is quite superior to other Mercure hotels, bathroom high class, and service is fast and professional.

Reviews.Title: “poor service”
Reviews.Author: doitnow1
Reviews.Content: I cannot understand why this hotel gets excellent reviews. I am staying here at the moment and to be perfectly honest it is poor. The worst Mercure I have stayed in and I stay at Mercure hotels all over Europe. The hotel is old, the bathrooms are very small and the bath/shower tiny. There are no coffee or tea facilities in any of the rooms no matter how much you are prepared to pay. The rooms are much smaller than usual. There is no restaurant or any means of finding something to eat in the evenings in the hotel. I cannot wait to leave. They have a vending machine down in the lobby or go search for a cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent attention to detail!”
Reviews.Author: MrLivingTheDream
Reviews.Content: Although Mercure is a generic hotel brand, this hotel is an exception to the rule. The hotel was convieniently located between the two Metro stations, Ventura Rodreiguez and Plaza de Espana it is about a five minuite walk from either. The hotel is located in the heart of plaza de espana, filled with local restaurants such as Saaron Tapas, Gino's Italian Restaurant as well as a McDonald's, Burger King and Starbucks. The area itself is pleasant and is located near the Red Bus Tour bus stop -- aimed at tourists. Upon arrival we were greeted by the receptionists who seemed polite and friendly and showed willingness to help. We had read reviews on here stating that you may be able to get a balcony room -- unfortunately there was only smoking balcony rooms at time of arrival however the staff were able to cater for us, placing us into rooms on the 4th floor which had a connecting door to each room, ideal for families booking two twin/double rooms. The hotel had a pleasant scent throughout and had period features such as the lifts and old fashioned telephones, the hotel had luxorious thick carpets. The room was located to the side and was overlooking a block of flats. It also had a shower which had instant hot water and plenty of towels, in addition to a face cloth which had lavender placed on the top. The room had 3 telephones, one in the bathroom, the desk and bedside -- calls to other rooms are free. The room also had an electronic safe and minibar which was €3.50 per item however there is a vending machine in the lobby which is much cheaper (around €1). The bed in the room was extreemly comfortable and the pillows were duck feather and down. There was also air conditioning and the window opened fully, ensuring the temperature was suitable. Breakfast -- it is advertised around the hotel that you get 3 croissants and a drink for €2.75 or a larger serving for €5 -- the picture is deceptive and makes the portions look bigger, there is no differention to the menu (eg. You can't swap the coffee for orange juice). The hotel does serve a breakfast however it costs €14 and it is contiental -- this is the only negative point as this price is too high based on choices avaliavble. As mentioned, there are other places which serve breakfast in the vincinity. The pictures on the website\on here make the rooms seem dated, however the rooms are lovely, they have character to them and are very clean. It's also nice to see a trouser press in a room these days! The price was very good, costing just £57 per ROOM per night -- excellent value for a capital city!! For great value, service and attention to detail, book this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Really good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great Staff on the front desk. The Man who checked me in was very helpful and telephoned another Mercure for me to ask about a Room....A really nice guy. I am thankful to alessandro for the Room he allocated us and I particularly enjoyed the Lounge Express Breakfast as the Croissants were better than those I have in France and the coffee was very good. The Service was excellent-the Lady who works Tuesday Morning was very good. Everything in the Room worked well. I slept well and enjoyed the Balcony. My Room was quiet. The Room was large' clean and nicely decorated. The Hotel is close to McDonalds and Burger King and a stones throw from The Don Quixote and Sancho Panza Statue in the Square. I would not hesitate in staying here again. Thanks again Mercure Plaza de Espana!

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel, okay location”
Reviews.Author: HermosaSteve
Reviews.Content: I was originally booked into the Hotel Mercure for a week, but a scheduling error forced me to move to another hotel. My review is based on only one night at the hotel. When I went to check in for my week in Madrid my scheduling error was discovered. So I only stayed at this hotel for one night, but it was a very good introduction to Madrid. The hotel is hard to find, but my limited Spanish helped me get there. I arrived and slept most of the day, but when I needed food the Swan was located just across the street. The manager was Ramon the night I went in, and The Swan became my return to reference point for my Madrid trip. They poured an excellent Guinness as well as Black and Tan, served up tasty tapas every time I went there (almost daily), and the restaurant upstairs had a strong menu and wine list. The Mercure rooms are old, the carpets threadbare, the balcony outside the units has an odd tilt as did most of the balconies there. The breakfast buffet, usually included in the room price, ends each day at the minute and second advertised, beware if you sleep late which I did. Even though the hotel is worn it was a nice place. My room had a balcony overlooking The Swan restaurant and one of the local plazas, and it was a good view. However, on the American Airlines site the hotel Mercure is more expensive than Hotel Liabeny, which I ultimately stayed at, and the Hotel Liabeny is a far better hotel than the Hotel Mercure. While I would stay at the Hotel Mercure again, I wouldn't do so if it was more expensive than the far better Hotel Liabeny.

Reviews.Title: “Mecure Madrid”
Reviews.Author: bodie_t
Reviews.Content: Good location to centre of Madrid, Staff very helpful with what to see and where to go. Clean lagre old style rooms. A short taxi ride to train station. would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: CarolineDV
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel. The building was very nice, some of the reviews here say it "needs updating" but I loved the classic style of it. Also the hall always smelled like it had just been cleaned. Staff was quite friendly and everything was very clean. GETTING THERE: We took the pink Metro line 8 at the airport* to the last stop (Nuevos Ministerios) and then got on the blue line 10 there and got off at stop Plaza d'España. From there it was just a short walk to the hotel. At Plaza d'Espana you could take the yellow line 3 and blue line 10, and also line 2 but for that you had to walk quite a way underground. *Look out because there are two stops at the airport: there's "Aeropuerto T1-T2-T3", which is where you have to get on/off if you come from that part of the airport (I think those are for national flights), but you get on/off at "Aeropuerto T4" if you come from T4 (we came from Belgium and that was our stop, so I guess that's just international flights). "Aeropuerto T4" is line 8's final stop, so if you have to get off there, that's very easy, you just stay on the Metro until the last stop. Also, when you go back from the hotel to the airport, you can't just get out of the Metro and in the airport; you have to buy a new ticket at the vending machines upstairs from the Metro at the airport. It's because they ask a 1 euro fee per person if you want to go to the airport with the Metro. FOOD: We had breakfast at the hotel. This was a nice buffet, not extremely large but good. We asked them where we could go have dinner and they told us we could to to Càscaras, which was very close to the hotel. We had dinner there on the last evening and it was great, so that was a really good tip. You could also have food brought up to your room, like a hamburger, pizza or pasta (there was a "menu" on the table in our room). I never did this so I don't know if it's good, but the price was OK so I guess it's worth a try :) ROOM: As I said before, it was clean and nice. We got shampoo/conditioner and shower/bath gel in the bathroom and there were clean towels every day (even though this wasn't necessary) and a hairdryer in the bathroom. There were no shower caps, so bring your own if you need one. In the bedroom there was a small table and a comfy chair, a desk with chair, and a TV. Our beds were comfortable and extra cushions and blankets were in the closet. Our closet was in the hallway and had a safe and a minibar. Everything in the minibar costs 3,5 euros, which I thought was quite expensive, so it's cheaper to go to the lobby and buy food or drinks at the vending machine since it's much cheaper there. SURROUNDINGS: The hotel is close to the Plaza d'España and you can take a walk to the Palazo Real from there. DOWNSIDE: The only thing I didn't like was that the room was very hot when we just arrived, it felt like the heating was on but it wasn't. But that got better when we turned the "heating" on and put it on 10°, when the colder air started blowing into our room it got a lot more agreeable. Overal, great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel...”
Reviews.Author: momofmombo
Reviews.Content: Comfortable beds, Rooms need updating.. TVs hardly work. Front desk staff acts like they don't want to be bothered. No bell staff to bring up bags. I would not recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, Desent rooms, Wifi was a bit irritating on my iPhone, Service was average...”
Reviews.Author: LESERLEE23
Reviews.Content: PRO: Great location near main roads, metro, Temple of Debod (great spot for sunset), and restaurants. Bed sheets were so comfy. CONS: Wifi is free, although, you need to access a username and pw from the front desk which expires within three days.. I was using it on my iPhone which was soo irritating bc it kept logging me off so I kept re-entering it every time I used it. Very limited in TV channels which was a downer. AC didn't work. We had a balcony but never used it bc it was just a view of the dirty street.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: PHLTraveler515
Reviews.Content: My wife and I used this hotel after not being able to book the Husa Princessa a few blocks away. We were very pleased with our choice, as hotels are meant to be clean, provide a great nights sleep and safe....nothing more. The property is older, but the check in was efficient and the property was clean. The room and bed were large and comfortable. Internet access was complimentary. It also had a very pleasant fragrance that had somewhat of a relaxing effect. The guys at the front desk made several reservations for us. We were able to get a table at Botin (roasted suckling pig was awesome). There was a fantastic little restaurant right next door that was awesome as well....I cannot remember the name. There is also a place two blocks on the other side of Plaza de Espana off the the first side street that has the best lobster paella. It is a small quaint place on the intersection of Calle de Langanitos and Calle le flor Baja. The best way to explore the city is to buy a two day ticket on the Madrid City Bus Tour.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly good”
Reviews.Author: NautiusMaximus
Reviews.Content: This hotel was mostly pretty good, although there were one or two negative points. Let's get them out of the way first. Breakfast was a bit of a disappointment. Although there was a reasonably good choice of hot and cold buffet (with some lovely local ham!), the coffee was a bit of a problem. Coffee came only from a single self-service coffee machine. I was there at the same time as a number of elderly people who were obviously struggling to operate the machine, so I had to wait for quite a while before the machine was available. It didn't even make particularly nice coffee. They really need to either serve you coffee like most hotels do, or at least put in a couple of extra machines. Also, the kiwi fruit in the fruit selection were not ripe. But apart from that, breakfast was fine. As other contributors have noted, the bar shuts at an unreasonably early time. I came back from dinner at 10 pm expecting to be able to have a beer in the hotel bar, but it was closed. The internet connection was included in the room rate that I paid, but it looked like it was quite expensive if you didn't have it included in your rate. Do check on this when you book if you want to use the internet. Apart from that, the hotel was pretty good. It used to be a Sofitel until a couple of years ago. As you probably know, Sofitel is another brand of the Accor group, who also own the Mercure brand, but Sofitels are generally more up-market than Mercures. The overall feel of the hotel was therefore considerably classier than the average Mercure. The bedroom was a good size, and had a very modern and nicely kitted out bathroom. There was a nice big in-room safe with plenty of room for even the least compact laptops. Oh, one more very small negative point: the choice of channels on the TV was rather limited. I'd normally expect to at least be able to get BBC World or CNN, but I couldn't find either of them or indeed any English language channels. The reception staff were perfectly helpful, and I didn't have to queue for one at any time. All in all, the negative points were not too serious, and to stay in what is almost a Sofitel-quality hotel at Mercure prices was a bargain. I'd probably stay there again if I go back to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Best location and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Tomorrow night will be my third trip to the hotel, so that tells a lot. During my most recent stay, I was upgraded for free to a balcony room. Take the balcony rooms if you can! The rooms are large, clean, and quiet. The bed is great as are the pillows! There is an additional door between the bedroom and the door to the hall. This makes sleeping even more quiet not that the hotel is noisy. The late nighters outside can be noisy, but the doors and windows to outside are soundproofed. The location is an easy walking distance to all of the major historical sites. There are a lot of tapas bars in the area with good food and great wine. The Internet in rooms and throughout the hotel should be the standard anywhere - FAST! The only negative is breakfast. High priced. There are restaurants within a block starting including Starbucks. I didn't like the coffee maker at breakfast. There is a snack and water/juice machine in the lobby. The staff is great. Professional, discreet, personable, and helpful. Obviously, a well run hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A hinder gem in the heart of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: J I
Reviews.Content: We booked our hotel through European Destinations, site unseen. However, when we arrived we loved it. The hotel is located only 5 minutes from Puerta de Sol (tons of shopping and great Tapas bars). One block away was the main street with just about everything and just two blocks away was Plaza de Espana with the famous statue of the Man of La Mancha. The hotel staff was very accommodating and knowledgeable; the hotel was spacious and very clean; the concierges was exceptional and the balconies romantic. If you want a treat at a great rate, try this hotel out.

Reviews.Title: “The Mercure standard”
Reviews.Author: plymouth
Reviews.Content: This must be my sixth or seventh Mercure since March last year and, by and large, you can rely on the quality. I stayed three nights with a work colleague and we liked the location, near to Pl de Espana Metro. The bedrooms we had were large with quite a corridor to the en-suite bathroom. We also had balconies. Bed very comfortable but you do notice how thick the duvet is because the air-conditioning will not go all that low. I would have left the balcony door open but there was just enough external noise to be intrusive. No bar facilities when we arrived at 9.30p.m. However, there is plenty of choice nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms, good location, friendly reception”
Reviews.Author: goevdp
Reviews.Content: Been here a couple of times now when travelling for business and was never dissappointed about the room or location. Rooms are spacious and well equiped. Always have been helped very well at the reception desk. If one remark, it would be the breakfast which is good but could be better.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: SundayNOLA
Reviews.Content: A fairly old property well located nearby a subway station in Madrid. One could expect better from a Mercure. The bathroom plug for the shaver in the bathroom did not work. I informed the housekeeping staff. Yet, the following day, nothing changed. But the rooms are quiet and clean. Breakfast was good but expensive for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “old but not bad”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: old style hotel, the furnitures and equipments are a bit dated except the flat screen TV . Otherwise spacious room, very clean with a real good bed, and good insulation from the hotel corridor, probably due to the quite long hallway in the room, wich, in my opinion, is a benefit for quietness. Staff efficient and ready to help. I didn't have breakfast so no comment on that point. Location is great, close to metro and gran via ( restaurants, shops......). Overall a good stay in this hotel, will probably go back.

Reviews.Title: “Old and in need of renovation”
Reviews.Author: J0epMeloen
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in this hotel for a city trip to Madrid. I have to say that offers accomodation at a central location (within walking range of all of central Madrid and close to the Plaza de España metro station) at a competitive price. However, the rooms were very old, dusty, and a bad smell seemed to be ever-present. It seemed the air conditioning could only be set to smouldering heat or brass monkeys, and every time we flushed the toilet, a sound like someone having a go with a pneumatic drill filled the room. I would not recommend staying at this hotel, although the city of Madrid is certainly worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER DISAPPOINTS...ROOMS NEED RENOVATION”
Reviews.Author: ICE-MOH
Reviews.Content: I always stay in this hotel with my family whenever we visit Madrid, we stayed there over 10 times in the past 10 years. The location is the best and the staff are wonderful and attentive. Its a shame the hotel is getting somewhat out of shape though, the rooms clearly need immidiate renovations.

Reviews.Title: “Near Temple Debod”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Modern clean responsive hotel. Handy to metro and hop on bus. Rode green bus from Airport and Taxi to door 15 euros from Atocha Taxis and people waited in orderly lines wihout a uniform in charge. Unbelievable!

Reviews.Title: “stay at Mercure Madrid Plaza de Espana”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very disappointing with lack of service capability - the bar was closed, there was no restaurant for meals other than breakfast, plus we were allocated a room where the TV service did not work. A very different stay experience from 12 months ago.

Reviews.Title: “If I go back to Spain I'll try and Find another place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Vinny102
Reviews.Content: So... It's a not horrible place but we got stuck in a smoking room as non smokers that was a rough start. The smell was really bad I do not consider myself not a picky person but .....none the less a non smoking room could have fixed that problem. One thing I thought was cool though everything in the mini bar was 3.5 euro which seemed a little cheaper than some of the other hotels. When trying to sleep The noise from the street level was pretty loud from the fourth floor we could here people talking through out the night. Location isn't too bad its close to plaza de espana, and calle gran via which is a major street with all sorts of restaurants,shops etc. This street will take you down to the Puerta de alcala my guess a 20 min walk. My opinion that was the best part of the hotel location. I purchased this hotel in a package so I don't not know the exact price but the only way I would stay here again would be if it was at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money in Central Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good rooms, with good beds. I had the topfloor with a view over the roofs, with a glimp of the Royal Palace. The only remark I have is about the lights: it seems impossible for hotels to replace broken lights. Internet was good. You have to ask for a new free key after 3 days. In the center, close to restaurants and metro.

Reviews.Title: “A bit rough at the edges”
Reviews.Author: beckyTelAviv
Reviews.Content: The location and the facility are rough about the edges. The location is technically "central", but the area has lots of graffiti-ed walls, which gives off a bit of a run-down feel to the area. Although at night there are lots of teenagers around - there seems to be a big rock club right around the corner. In any case, I think it might be more fun to be closer to Sol which is the commercial/shopping center of the city. The hotel itself is also a bit rough around the edges. Old wooden closets and drawers, the kind grandma used to line with doilies or shelving paper, but these were unlined and rough. No water kettle or coffee or tea in the room, poor television reception which in English was limited only to news stations and one sports station. Breakfast was quite nice, Nespresso coffee machine which was a nice touch beyond the standard morning coffee.

Reviews.Title: “good deal”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: just happened to get an e mail from Accor hotels with a special non refundable rate that was just too good to pass up. Although I didn't really know where this hotel was located when I booked it worked out fine as we were close to the Metro and could walk to some of the sites. The room did not have any kind of view but was quiet and bright.

Reviews.Title: “Short Stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Rooms on the small side but who needs to be in the room when you're in the middle of Madrid. Excellent food and drinks nearby, plenty of shopping and things to see. Excellent service from the friendly staff. Breakfast buffet was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Good value option in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Lion_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3x nights after booking directly through the Mercure website for €232 excluding breakfast. The hotel is located about a 20min walk from the Royal Palace on a minor road behind the Plaza De Espana. The hotel is very very dated but at the same time perfectly functional and very clean. The beds are very comfortable and the shower works well. We had a bit of noise from doors slamming and plumbing but nothing major. There are plenty of places nearby to get breakfast much cheaper than the exorbitant €16 per person charged by the hotel. Taxis are plentiful in the area and it's about €5 into the centre of town and around €35 to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Older Hotel with Room for Improvements”
Reviews.Author: SavvyDesigner
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for only 2 nights in Madrid. The location is not bad, very accessible and nearby the Metro stations but far enough from the street noises of Grand VIa. The hotel is old and you can see the signs of wearing and aging. There are two elevators, but one of the elevators was under repair. We used the stairs most of the time because the 1 elevator that is operating is very slow and also very small. The decor is old and frumpy. Even though the furnishings were older, I do appreciate that all the tables and even the bathrooms are made with real marble and not some of the cheaper, less durable materials that newer hotels use. There is even a bidet in the bathroom, so I know this type of hotel belongs in the older generation and class. If they would just bring in a fresh set of soft seating and carpeting, this hotel would be so much more appealing. That said, at least the mattresses are newer and seem to be replaced more often.

Reviews.Title: “A perfectly good choice”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well-located for transport links, but slightly out-of-the-way. Rooms and general decor are good, but I found the walls were thin and there was unwanted noise from the next door rooms. However, bed very comfortable - and free wi-fi a great bonus.

Reviews.Title: “It is not a Sofitel anymore...”
Reviews.Author: ludo_swinnen
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located in Madrid. There is close by a Metro (Prado) and on foot you can easily reach the Royal Palace or the Plaza Mayor. The rooms are still in Sofitel style and quite confortable. Unfortunately the hotel is not very well taken care of: broken lights are not repaired, the printer linked at the public PC is not working, the lift is often out of order and the furniture in the lobby shows traces of being used for many years.So if such things get on your nerves, do not go there. But the friendly personal and the stylish interior largely compensate for it. So, in a nutshell, it is a good hotel for a few days in Madrid (but get a good price!).

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: JIMMYDEFARGO
Reviews.Content: This hotels offers a great value. It`s a former Sofitel (Luxury brand of Accor hotel group) and was now converted into an Mercure hotel (Middle class brand). However, the rooms haven`t been refurbished and so you find still the luxury Sofitel furniture. The rooms are a bit dated but offer an excellent value. They have sometimes rates as low as 60 Euros/night. High season rates of 100 Euros and more might be a bit overpriced for this hotel. The location is quite good. Its just a 5 minute walk from the `grand via` a main road where you find many shops, restaurants & hop on/off bus stops. There is a lot of store and restaurants nearby. Staff is quite friendly& helpful. Free wifi with moderate speed is offered on request at the reception. You get a 3-day voucher, if you stay longer just request another one. The bed is comfy but a bit soft (depends pretty much on personal preference). There is only one drawback: The hotel does not have an restaurant (exept for breakfast). They offer room service thru an local pizza delivery which has quite bad reviews. That is more hostel like.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice and value”
Reviews.Author: jcolesw2
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in October 2011. A good hotel, good location and good price. The staff were friendly, the beds comfortable and a good stay enjoyed by all. Well situated, close to a metro station but an easy walk to the Royal Palace, Plaza Mayor etc and some decent bars and restaurants in the immediate vicinity. Good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Tron-topia
Reviews.Content: This well located hotel, two blocks from Plaza Espana and a block from the metro line, made visiting this spectacular city very easy. There are many eating and drinking options near the hotel, while the Palacio Real and other central amenities are within comfortable walking distance (depending on the heat!). A mini supermarket can also be found nearby. If you are interested in films, a dedicated film bookshop and a couple of cinemas are sitauted one block away, toward the plaza. We can perhaps understand why this hotel has been reclassified within the Accor brand, however, we found the rooms to be very comfortable and clean and thought the staff were obliging. The free Wi-Fi was convenient and allowed us to arrange our onward travel.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: ChesterJohn
Reviews.Content: My wife and i have just returned back from madrid following 3 days there this weekend. The room we stayed in was very good and the location of the hotel was absolutely brilliant as there was a metro station nearby, a hop on hop off bus stop nearby and it wasnt too far to walk to the the royal palace or puerto del sol if you wanted from here. If i had any issues with the hotel i would say that the walls were rather thin so we could hear the cleaner in the morning. Note: the cleaners come very early so put the notice on the door saying do not disturb, we had the cleaner one morning coming at 8am which was too early for us. The bar is no existant, in 3 days we never seen anyone there let alone anyone serving but it didnt bother us as that is not what we came for. I would try to get a room where there is a balcony, it was quite nice to be able to go outside and get fresh air when hot. If i could give a word of warning, if you are sitting in the plaza de espana park be very careful. We had a man try to steal our bag from behind whilst we were sitting on a bench, if i hadnt of seen him and shouted he would have probably stole it. We were naive however and left the bag to our side so if you just be sensible as whilst it is a fantastic place to visit and see, it is still a city! Overall dont let that ruin the idea of madrid, its a great place to visit and the mecure is a great place to start form.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is OK,but not a 41/2 star rated !”
Reviews.Author: Liborius
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three nights last week at this hotel. The room has a very good standard - it´s clean and proper.But it is not a 4 star hotel! For example -there was not TWO comfortable chairs! Other facilities is "oldfashioned" -dark and not modern.In other words -it don`t invite you to sit in the bar or lobby. The breakfast is -as many others in Spain hotels -expensive:15 Euro. The hotel is situated very central and there are a coulple of restuarants in the nearness. At last:Will we return to this hotel? NO!!!

Reviews.Title: “An great base to explore this great city”
Reviews.Author: itravelaround
Reviews.Content: I arrived along with my girlfriend on September 8th for a 3 night stay. We took the Metro from the airport to Plaza de Espana (35 min). It's less than a 10 minute walk to the hotel. Check in was a breeze. The room was standard size (for Europe) that included a double bed and balcony. It also included a min bar and safe (free). The WiFi (free) was great. We didn't eat at the hotel. Just outside the doors are many restaurants (local,Greek,Italian,McDonalds,Burger King). Along with Plaza de Espana, there is another Metro location (Ventura Rodriguez) which is a 5 min walk. The hop on/hop off bus stop is 5 min away. I suggest you just walk and get lost in this great city.The hotel met expectations, but the city of Madrid far exceed them. I can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: rskblueyes
Reviews.Content: To start, the Front Desk Staff were very pleasnt at check-in. They provided us with maps and circled various sights with-in central-Madrid. The room was very large for european standards done in a classical -modern style.The bathroom was marbled with many toiletries. Beds were very comfortable. When I reserved the room , I selected the breakfast option thinking it was going to be continental breakfast. What I actually got was a breakfast buffet. The slection was very large consisting of various hams, bacon, fruits, cereral, pasteries , juices and coffee. All very good. The service at the hotel was wonderfull, all the staff very friendly. The hotel is very clean. The location is wonderfull as you are in walking distance to 2 meto stations which can take you anywhere in central Madrid in a matter of minutes. Another plus is across the street from the hotel is an area consisting of several resturants some chain type other independent ones if you want to grab a lunch or dinner. If you have young children I suggest VIPS, McDonalds or Burger King.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for exploring Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Nowhereman1999
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a four night stay in the Mercure Madrid Plaza de Espana. Pluses and minuses about the hotel but overall I'd say it was good value for money. Transfer from the airport to the hotel is easy via the (excellent) metro system - 1 change required and then a 5 minute walk from Plaza de Espana metro station to the hotel. The district where the hotel is situated is a little grubby but OK, and never felt unsafe even after midnight. The hotel was very clean, the room had very comfy beds and a nice bathroom, some of the woodwork was looking in need of a refresh though. The TV wasn't great, the only English channels we could get were CNN and Eurosport and the picture was a bit fuzzy. That said, we don't go on holiday to watch television. There are lots of places to eat nearby in Princesa, some chains including McDs, BK, Starbucks as well as local restaurants. Don't go for a drink in the "Irish Pub" opposite the hotel though unless you enjoy being overcharged - go to the "Museo de Cerveza" or beer museum/restaurant around the corner which is much more reasonable. The hotel has cabled internet in the room which is chargeable, but also has wifi which is free if you ring and ask for a key from reception. The speed on wifi seemed OK if not lightning fast. Finally - an important point - every member of staff we met were very friendly and helpful - they are a credit to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Familia_Sampaio
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in August/2011, where we booked 2 connected rooms for our family. The beds are good but the rooms with the extra-bed become a little bit uncomfortable. The Hotel is somehow needing a renovation. It is dark and the furniture seems outdated. The air-conditioning was not working properly and the temperature during the night was not so comfortable. The breakfast is ok but the service starts at 07:00am a little late for people that needs to go to the airport and there is no early breakfast available. The rooms are clean and the staff is polite. The hotel is close to the Plaza de Espana and you can walk also until the Debod Temple. There is also subway station close to the hotel as well the tourism bus. We enjoyed a lot visiting Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very central to everything and only a 15 min bus trip to Sol which is one of the many great places in Madrid to see and also do a spot of Shopping. The Hotel its shelf was a great little place with a lo of character. The staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Renovation is a must”
Reviews.Author: MKC_PRC
Reviews.Content: Booked and fully paid two rooms two months ahead where a simple request for connecting room was not entertained. Was told only one connecting room available upon checking - in but water was dipping from aircon. Counter was helpful and said I had choice to choose two separate rooms but the two rooms were located at two ends. Hence, it wont be able to look after my kids. SELECTED the connecting rooms but water was indeed running out of the aircon instead of dipping. Nothing would be done as it was Sunday. Mini bar were different from one to another though the lists were same. Make up room was done like that were not done before as MIN effort was made. Sinks were either broken or cracked. Room were wearing out a lot that full renovation needed right away. Tv stands broken as well. It did not accept my A. Card as it was issued in Asia but Mecure is clearly part of Accor group. Dont stay. !

Reviews.Title: “Well done for a great stay at Mercure Plaza de Espana”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Our email requests were recognised and we had top floor rooms together in quiet location. The double terrace was a great added value for one of our rooms - first class. Nothing was too much trouble and we plan to return off-season for another visit. From stepping in to the reception from a rather hot Madrid afternoon to leaving it was a "cool" experience in several ways!. Some features of the hotel are classic but certainly added character. A few signs of Sofitel in the rooms gave away the properties pedigree as well as a quality feel. Shop around for great rates.. good location and lots nearby. Safe district and well located for shops, transport and dining opportunities.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Helpful multilingual staff, very convenient location puts you within walking distance of many major sites of interest and some excellent restaurants, comfortable rooms and secure parking (a rarity in this location).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: gleisonbarreto
Reviews.Content: It's a very nice hotel. The rooms are fantastic, the bed is very comfortable and the breakfast is nice. It's in a great location in Madrid, very safe with a lot to do in the whereabouts.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel of our trip”
Reviews.Author: beepsnrays
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights at this hotel (during our 28-day trip), and we LOVED it. It has definitely been the most comfortable, cleanest hotel of our trip. Contrary to the previous review, we had plenty of electrical outlets in convenient places and the bed was plush and comfortable. The breakfast buffet was varied and satisfying. We loved the convenience of its location and were able to walk nearly everywhere, and when we needed the metro it was just around the corner. We always felt safe when walking around the local neighborhood--even when coming back after dinner. Overall we were very happy with this hotel and would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but overall experience just ok”
Reviews.Author: bnhall
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel numerous times over the years, and spent 3 nights here in mid-July. The hotel is very well located, walking distance to Sol and Plaza Mayor area as well as Calle Princesa shops, and the metro is close as well. The rooms are always a tad disappointing though, with the beds not quite comfortable enough, and little annoying things like telephone not working and plugs not located in the obvious spots. This seems to be the trend in Madrid though, so I rank this hotel just "ok".

Reviews.Title: “Just what I need”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Helpfull and friendly staff "asked about coffee maker and they provde me with one", good location near 2 metro stations "Paza de Espina" & "Ventura Rodriguez" and Gran via, and quality room with balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and well located”
Reviews.Author: ChezSoiree
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel located close to Plaza Espana. We had a room towards the back so it was quiet. I thought the location was fantastic. You can easily walk to many monuments and museums. The staff was great and extremely helpful with our inquiries, The room service menu was limited but the service quick, The breakfast buffet was good. The internet was included in the price which was great. Starbucks is a few meters away, overall, great stay for a great price. I would recommend it and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cledra
Reviews.Content: First impressions of a beautifully kept hotel. The lift door was odd and required hand opening. The best bed and pillows on our whole trip. Breakfast was nice but could have had more hot food. I found far too much sweet cakes or cold meats. Enjoyed our stay, however the front desk staff should make sure the guest they are being rude about do not actually speak Spanish and understand the comments made.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: CERROMERRO
Reviews.Content: This hotel is walking distance to anything you want to see in the historic part of Madrid. It's 2 minutes walking to the infamous Don Quixote and Sancho Panza statues! The royal place is 10 minutes walking. If you take a tourist bus, you can walk 2 minutes and you can get your ticket. It is also 2 minutes walking to the Metro. If you want a cab, millions of them pass in from of the hotel. Being so in the centre, it is not noisy at all. Our sleep was not disturbed at any time. As for the breakfast is concerned, it was a decent buffet. There was milk, coffee, tea (twining), orange juice, water and all. There was fruit. There was pastry. There were two types of ham. There were two types of cheese. There was chorizo and something else. After all, it is an Accor hotel and it is decent enough. The room was neat. We booked a room in the upper floor to enjoy the balcony and the view to the city but I think it is kind of pointless to have a balcony which is as big as the room itself if not bigger. If you are interested in the view, there is not much to see, so drop this option. The staff is polite. However upon arrival and after check-in noone proposed us to carry the suitcases. We were also quite happy because the staff at the reception can speak English. I would recommend this hotel to anybody who will spend a few days in Madrid in order to explore the historic side of the city!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel. Would definitely use again.”
Reviews.Author: Bebej1976
Reviews.Content: Spent one weekend at the Mercure Plaza Espania. Is a really charming hotel, very well maintained and clean with high end fittings and plenty of modern additions as well. Easy walking distance from Plaza Espania yet also quiet as tucked just off the main road. Very friendly and efficient staff. On check in we were asked if we prefer a smoking or non-smoking room. Neither of us smoke so we said non-smoking. The receptionist however said that the smoking room had a bacony whereas the non-smoking rooms that he had available did not. We took the smoking room as the idea of a balcony sounded good and we were not disappointed. We thought this was nice of the receptionist. The room we had (410) was large (by european standards), very well appointed and clean. Same can be said for the lobby and corridors.....all seemed to have been recently refurbished in classic continental style. There is wired internet in the room or a PC station in the lobby for charge. WIFI both in the lobby and room however is free. If I had to find any negative aspects: Services within the hotel are quite limited. The room service menu is extremely limited. Literally a choice of sandwiches and the like. Not a problem for us as we had no plan to use room service with the plethora of eating options on the hotel doorstep. Also there is no bar or restaurant in the hotel (the bar aea is only open at breakfast). Tea and coffee facilities would have been nice in the room. And it seemed that perhaps they could do with an extra staff member or two. At 9pm on the Sunday night while getting ready for an evening out I realised my shirt could do with an iron. I went down to reception to ask if they had one I could borrow but the receptionist said he was the only staff member in the property at that time and couldnt leave the desk. It wasnt a huge deal for me but I could imagine that for perhaps someone that had a business dinner or similar to attend it could be an issue. But all in all a real gem of a hotel and I will definitely be back next time I visit Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, should have higher rating”
Reviews.Author: ab2000
Reviews.Content: Had a really good experience in the hotel. The room and shower are relatively big, and very clean. Wi-fi working great and for free. The breakfast has nice variety of cheese, bread, bacon, cakes, fruits, and hot/cold drinks. Staff is customer oriented and speaks English well. The hotel is located about 3 minutes walk from Plaza de Espana, near Cerralbo museum and close to park with the egyptian temple. It's also close to the Royal Palace. Several metro stations are in 5 minutes walk from the hotel. (Plaza de Espana, Ventura Rodriguez) I would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: xgeorgeAthens
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mercure Madrid Plaza De Espana (listed as Sofitel in our GPS) for an extended weekend in May. The hotel is easy to reach on foot from the Plaza De Espana metro station, providing easy access to the airport (you need to change trains twice, but it is very easy and quite fast), and the Noviciado metro station is a bit further away, but still walking distance. The area around the hotel is nice and quite lively, since there are many cafes and bars on the main street one block from the hotel, plus a little plaza one block from the hotel hosts food stores, coffee and a convenience store. You can walk to the Palace and the Opera, and take the metro to the outstanding Madrid museums. Getting to Puerta del Sol and the Plaza Mayor requires a bit more walking (25 around minutes) or two metro stops. The metro is very fast, efficient and runs late at night, so the location of the hotel works well for everything. The hotel itself is very nice, it has an old world charm and the rooms and interior decorations are on the grand side (especially the ground floor). Apart from the furniture which could do with some reworking (being chipped at many points), the room was in an excellent condition, the bathrooms were fine and the Internet access (included in the price) very satisfactory. Cleaning was meticulous. Breakfast was very good but not as excellent as in some other Mercure hotels; it could do with some more variety, although everything on offer was of excellent quality. The reception was very helpful with whatever we asked. Finally, the advance booking rates for the hotel were a real bargain for this level of hotel. Madrid tips: The center of Madrid is not so big, so if you don't mind some walking, don't buy daily metro tickets, just get a 10 trip ticket, it will last long. Get the Paseo Del Arte card and make sure you visit the three great museums (Prado, Thyssen-Bosnemisza and Centro De Arte Reina Sofia). Finally, if you can spare a day, Toledo is 35 minutes by train and is a beautiful city with tons of things to see.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Hotel for a city trip.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Centrally located near the Plaza espana and Palais Royal. Walking distance to other major attractions of Madrid. We were initially given a non smoking room on the 1st floor which was small with the window overlooking the roof of some houses and smelly. Not at least the room i was expecting compared to the pictures on the hotel website ! After complaining we were told to come back in 2 hours when some rooms would be freed. The room allocated was much better, clean and quiet : thumb up to the personnel ! Breakfast was on the high side, particularly so as across the road it is 1/3rd the price ! So stay there but have breakfast/Lunch/dinner outside !

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Everything about the hotel was great, but unfortunately in 50% of the hotels we have stayed in the vent in the bathroom was not working, we could have asked for another room but we were lucky enough to get a balcony room after asking for one, and thought we were lucky that way. The T.V. in the room was a bit "iffy" as we were not able to get any English programmes only the American news, but this did not spoil our wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent hotel, beatiful and confortable”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mercure Madri Plaza de Espana for one night only, but it was excellent. The decoration of the hotel is very beautiful, we parked our car in the garage for 15 euros, the breakfast was very good and the room was clean with a very confortable bed. The location, in Plaza de Espana is near a Mc Donalds and Burger King, and from there we can reach downtown in a 15 min walk. The city is very pleasant and the buildings are astonishing. Wish we could stay more days!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel for stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: As I was travelling on my own and had never been to Madrid before I wanted a hotel that was a decent standard and convenient. I was not disappointed as the hotel was close to the Metro, it had a traditional Spanish style and was very clean. The staff were very helpful and the buffet breakfast was excellant. If I ever return to Madrid I would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, huge room, great service, excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: joshchicago
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 3 nights in Madrid and fell in love with the neighborhood. The Temple of Debod is an Egyptian temple that is placed in a park at the end of the street and from there, at sunset, hundreds of locals gather to watch the sunset. You'll never read about that in a guidebook, but it was just one of the magical experiences we had while staying at this hotel. The hotel is located near all the major Madrid sights, walking distance to pretty much everything in the central city. We walked to Plaza Mayor, the Prado, Gran Via, Chueca district, and other great hot spots really easily. The hotel staff were very friendly and helped us get a reservation at a local Flamenco show at the last minute. After staying in hotels in Barcelona and Paris the room seemed huge. We had a balcony with a door that opened so we could get a nice breeze. The bathroom was large and everything was super clean. The bed was extremely comfortable, as were the pillows. I wanted to find out the make of the mattress so I could buy it at home - I slept so good. Fantastic value in a fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money ,Clean , Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Farshad74
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mercure Madrid Plaza de Espana hotel for 3 nights, Positive: 1- Front desk staff are Very Good specially Mr. Enrique and other one who was speaking very good English and he did a good help to me to find my requests from drugstore and pharmacy and a tall lady in Breakfast area who was a good help all the time and she was also speaking english . 2- Clean room and Wc and the housekeeping was good 3- Location is really good to reach supermarket ,fast-food and resto and Madrid tour Bus 4- Bed is really good and big size 5- Sleep quality is good at hotel located in a quiet and calm area 6- The area is safe 7-Free Wifi High speed Internet 8- Good services from Hotel Team all the time Negative: 1- Problem in AC in the Room 2- Problem in TV and Remote in the Room 3- Breakfast is Average and it is not good compare to Hotel Stars Finally it was a good stay and it was a good Value for money that I paid

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service and Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Daniela1013
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this lovely hotel which is very close to the metro and many tourist attractions. The hotel concierge and staff were very helpful in answering all our questions and very accommodating. They offered to book reservations for restaurants and provided us with accurate directions when needed. The rooms were always clean, had a security safe, mini-fridge, free internet access, and pant press. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom amenities fit our needs very well. Out overall experience with this hotel was excellent! I would stay there again and highly recommend others to stay there as well.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff and great location make Mercure a winner...”
Reviews.Author: Qlever
Reviews.Content: Traveling through a country on a last-minute trip with little time for planning can mean relying on the help of others to find the best deals and experiences. Thanks to the helpful team at Mercure, my friend and I felt confident exploring the city. The free wifi made the room a retreat where we could quickly research our picks and rest up before our next adventure. Metro access gets an A+.

Reviews.Title: “Clean friendly Hotel in central location.”
Reviews.Author: Narathip
Reviews.Content: From the moment you enter this Hotel you notice how friendly and helpful the staff are.It is situated near the Plaza De Espana just beyond the lower end of the Grand Via and near the Metro Station.The Hotel itself has very clean pleasant rooms with all the normal facilities of heating and air-conditioning.I would recommend this Hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here, Ever!”
Reviews.Author: netbluez
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mercure Madrid Plaza de Espana hotel for two nights in Feb 2011. The male receptionist at check in was brusque and unhelpful. The room was quite small and had an unpleasent smell. The breakfast was pathetic, with a tiny selection. The offered rate as more than 110 euro per night, I wouldn't rate it worth around 60 euro per night. One a slightly positive side, the hotel is very close to the happening places of Madrid (Gran Via, Plaza de Espana) and the most visited Palace and Debold temple. The metro is very close as well. Given, Madrid's good metro network and cheap taxis the location advantage is very minimal and not worth the 50 Euro premium. (There is another Mercure closer to Gran Via (Santo Domingo), which seemed much better from the outside. Don't confuse that with this one) I ended up checking out earlier than planned, as I wasn't happy with the room, the breakfast or the service. Unless you are severly constrained or get a room offered for 60 Euro (or less), don't stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, would definately stay at again”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice, very easy to get to from the metro. Room/hotel was all clean, staff were nice, when we first arrived the chap at the front desk gave a map and detailled description of were things were in Madrid. Very impressed, and would certainly consider staying at this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Andrey_Buzin
Reviews.Content: The place is proudly marked with 4 stars. Well, 2 1/2 would be OK for it. But the price is maybe a bit too high for 4 stars indeed. Actually, not all taps in the room were OK, some sockets were removed from walls, room not very clean. Balcony door was not tight, and there was wind there all the time. But the most disturbing was noise. Every time I come to Spain half the population of the city somehow learns about the fact, they come to may hotel at noght and start cry loudly as if they speak across a wheat field. Tht's their business, of course, but why couldn't the room was protected against it?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for visiting Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Bellou2
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for visiting Madrid. Walking distance of many of the main areas of interest.. The hotel was very clean and service very good. Very good buffet breakfast . Rooms were a good size , as was the bathroom. We spent four nights there and could not fault this hotel at all . Although city centre not noisy. Helpful reception staff . Metro from the airport to the Plaza de Espagna only costs 2 euros! Just a few minutes walk to the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good for short break”
Reviews.Author: Steveie B
Reviews.Content: Five mins walk from metro Plaza de Espana which is 40 mins from Airport. Hotel is far enough to be away from the really busy part of the city but there was some noise on a saturday night. Madrid is a "late" city so I suppose this could be expected. You could ask for a higher level room if you think this could be a problem. Reception staff were very helpful. Breakfast was reasonable for th price but cheaper alternatives are available within 10 mins walk.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful receptionists”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The receptionists are helpful and gave good directions to requested venues. They are also able provide excellent recommendations on restaurants, places of interests etc.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel, fab location”
Reviews.Author: holidayerLondon
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived we didn't think the hotel looked like it was in a great location, but as we got to know Madrid we thought it was perfect. You can walk into the centre, and to the Royal palace, but it's not too noisy. We had a double non smoking room with a balcony and paid 77 euros per night, on a stay 3 nights get 1 free offer. It was enormous! Really well decorated, very simple and with the corridor leading into the bathroom and then the bedroom it felt very grand. Bed was massive and incredibly comfortble. Only downsides... No kettle in the room, and no towel dressing gowns. Otherwise it's great, highly reccommended. If you go to Madrid, try and get to La Finca de Susana restaurant near Seville metro station - its fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “good location for 2-3 days”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: good location (please note that the hotel is NOT at plaza de espana. it is at calle de tutor 1, which is 5 mins from plaza, an nobody knows where it its :) no choice of rooms (we got smoking room), otherwise, good breakfast, good location (8mins from metro, 25mins from puerta del sol)

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Everything was clean and comfortable. Everyone was helpful. The overall experience was excellent. I would stay here again if I were to return to Madrid, and I've already recommended the hotel to other people.

Reviews.Title: “A royal treat, but a bit stinky”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Mercure Plaza de Espana is perfectly placed - just far enough off the main drag to miss all the street noise, but an easy walk to the sites of Old Madrid and good restaurants. The staff were really helpful and didn't mind my bad Spanish. However, the breakfast is ridiculously overpriced at 18e (we didnt eat it, but it didn't look exciting), when you can eat for a fraction at plenty of local places. We booked early so got a good deal on the room rate. Our room was very comfortable and spacious, BUT it stank of stale cigarette smoke :(

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Venice323
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel and one must be mindful of that when booking at this establishment. But it has, by far, the most comfortable bed I have slept in during my recent trip to Spain and Portugal. The furniture, however, is a bit dated. The reception staff is incredibly nice and made several great recommendations. Finally, the location is great. And, of course, the value is undisputed. It is one of those, what you see is what you get type of places and you will not be disappointed if your expectations are not sky high.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Service, ugly room”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is 5 minutes walk form Plaza de Espagna. If you go there by Metro,you cannot find it easily. The recepitionist was rude. No smile, nearly no hello or goodby. No please and thank you. He charged my credit card although I had a prepaid room. Only later he explained that my credit card had not gone through before. The room was dark and looked to a dark yard and the ac and the outlet air of the hotel. (Was he only one of that kind). When we asked for another room the receptionist clearly showed he disliked this. It seems that women are not welcome there. I am a returning guest and showed my Accor card.

Reviews.Title: “Super”
Reviews.Author: fly747
Reviews.Content: This hotel used to be a Sofitel and there are a few tell tale signs around. Checkin was quick and the front desk explained breakfast times, gave us maps and was very helpful and polite. 2 old fashioneds lifts added character to the place, room was superb,on the top floor large entry hall with wardrobe and very small fridge, bathroom with more amenities than you would expext from a Mercure, robes, slippers, toothbrush, hairbrush, shoeshine, clean towels and clean sheets daily. Flat screen TV, (although not much on in English), french doors opened up to a huge balcony / terrace with sunlounger and table & chairs.The room aircon did struggle to keep the room cool though and in the end we opted to keep the door open instead for a breeze. Breakfast was a bit dissapointing compared to other Mercure hotels i have stayed in, but it was adequate, mainly breads, cheese, hams, yoghurt, fruit, Don't expect a full English. There is a computer with a printer just off the lobby which costs 7 euros if you need to check in for your flight, although it wasnt working on the day due to a power cut but just down the road by the pharmacy there is an internet cafe. Hotel is in a fab location, 5 minutes from playa de espana, and royal palace about 15 minute walk. Outside hotel is a few restaurants and also a Starbucks, Burger King, McDonalds and a small supermarket. A huge Cortes de Ingles supermarket is about 10 minutes walk away. Metro station is 100 yards away. Overall, we had a lovely stay, friendly staff, great location and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy little hotel - recommended!”
Reviews.Author: JAGBP
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights here in September 2010. Staff is _very_ friendly, rooms are nice and clean. (some say they are 'old', but I love these 'old' furniture - and they are not destroyed, not 'old' in that meaning) Our room was ugraded to one with a huge balcony at no additional costs (without asking!). Don't know the breakfast, but nearby café's offer fresh and solid food at decent prices, so we went down to them every morning. Free WiFi is a great advantage and works perfect all around in the hotel (not only in the lobby as in other hotels). And last but not least a great location for reaching the Metro or the Madrid Vision bus tour (all in a few minutes' walking distance). The only thing that is true that the walls are _very_ thin between the rooms, so you hear practically everything.. Highly recommended for a weekend or for even longer stay!

Reviews.Title: “Walk to a lot without all the noise at night!”
Reviews.Author: JudyDBrooksville
Reviews.Content: Older decor.....breakfast just ok. Price is great and the room adequate. But could walk everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Hear what next door is doing 24/7”
Reviews.Author: Geraldo_Bonzo
Reviews.Content: Sure,it 's a great location, free wifi and the rooms look smart and tidy but the walls are so thin you hear everything next door is doing. Listen in to their phone calls, hear the soundtrack of their movie and ... well I leave the rest to your imagination! Hey, it's not just next door, it's those living above and below as well! We booked 2 rooms and it was exactly the same for both. It's a great location but I wouldn't return any time soon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: simonp820
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for just one night in June (although I wish it was more!) Not your typical Mercure (more a traditional English hotel) but it works! The hotel is right in the centre of Madrid and was a little difficult to find (although I blame that on Jaguar's GPS and the Metro strike!) Check-in was smooth and the friendly and helpful English-speaking staff were great to deal with. Stayed in a large suite on the sixth floor which was immaculate. It was clean, spacious and had everything you could possibly need. Internet was a bit pricey (18EUR for the night) especially as many othe Accor hotels give it free. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: imlauer
Reviews.Content: Great Location, right in the Heart of the CIty Center. Nice large rooms, very clean and friendly Staff. Breakfast is ok ( i saw a lot better already at mercure) The guys at the reception are very helpfull and know about everything. It used to be a Sofitel just changed to Mercue. If u have time try to go to Escorial and Segovilla

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: gp4titan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for around 3 weeks on a business trip. The cost was company negotiated so I guess, I payed less that what is available. The hotel is at great location with 2 mins walk to Metro Station, Gram Via, MacD, Starbucks, Princesa Cinema. The whole street is full of Restaurants and bars where one can have fun all the night. At the other end of the street there is Templo de Debod ( the Egyptian Temple) and the beautiful Montana Park. I went there multiple times for evening sunset walks and morning jog. The hotel staff is friendly. Few of the members are not very friendly but they are up to the mark. The balcony at the room was wonderful with nice view of south madrid at the street end. I would recommend this Hotel and will stay here again if I get a chance to visit Madird again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and sleep in nice digs”
Reviews.Author: CAKatie
Reviews.Content: We booked this for our first night in Madrid as we were arriving on a Sunday and it was convenient to El Rastro and to where we were picking up our car the next day (Sixt at Hotel Tirol). AND the price was right at 105 Euros. We arrived around 9:00 a.m. after getting in from the States. The front desk was very helpful and kindly gave us a room immediately (Room 606). We were able to freshen up and head out to a glorious Sunday in the city before 11:00 a.m. The room was small, but had a nice sized bathroom with toiletries, good quality towels and a great shower. The bed was king-sized and the best one we slept in on our trip, with good thread-count sheets and a wonderful duvet. It was not the brick-hard bed we found at other hotels in Spain. Our room also had a nice balcony off of it, which we would have enjoyed had we stayed longer than the one night. It was big with a table and chairs, with a view of the neighborhood. The hotel is close to two metro stops and comfortable walking distance to Plaza Mayor, Palacio Real and the Catedral. There isnt a lot right around the hotel but just a block away is a small plaza with McDonald's and Starbucks, should you need those in a city of fabulous eats and drinks, and two blocks from Plaza de Espana. The front desk staff moved easily from Spanish to English to French and were helpful in recommending restaurants, calling for information (found out we were too late for the Segway tour) and making suggestions for walks. Had this been closer to the museum triangle we would have returned here for the last two nights we spent in Madrid. It was quiet, comfortable, convenient and the bed was the best.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: VitaliyS
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in May as a part of trip dedicated to the 4th anniversary of our wedding. Prior to coming I wrote the letter to the hotel mentioning our anniversary and they informed us that we will be provided with the nice room with rose for my wife and bottle of Cava (their famous sparkling wine). The check in was very efficient and fast, we were given the room on the 4th floor overlooking the street but vey quite. The room is of good size (please note that they have 2 types of standard rooms with small balcony and and without it - rooms without balcony are bigger for the size of this absent balcony - as was our room - so if you want bigger room ask for one without balcony, or go for higher category where the balcony is big and room also big), with huge and comfortable bed (when I booked this hotel was still Sofitel, changed at the end of last year to Mercure, but at the moment the bed is still the famous Sofitel bed!), the bathroom is OK, with bathtube, bidet magnifying mirror and standard Mercure amenitites, bathrobe and slippers. The buffet breakfast was of good quality, but a little overpriced as for me (18 Euros/person) taking into account that some standatd things for hotel of such class were missing (e.g. no smoked salmon or possibility to cook omelette). Also they have express breakfast option - big croissant, orange juice and coffee/tea for only 5 Euros - very convenient if you don't have time, but want to eat smth. The location of hotel is very good - 2 minutes by foot to Venturo Rodrigues metro station and 4 minutes to Plaza Espagna (were another metro station is situated), at the same time only 5 minutes by foot to Debod castle and not more than 10 minutes to Royal Palace. The service was good and the hotel was clean. The value for money was fantastic - we paid only 246 Euros for 3 days without breakfast. Hotel has free wifi (if you come with your laptop or palm), but unfortunately use of their only PC is charged heavily - 7 Euros for 30 minutes of Internet connection !!! - should be changed somehow. One more minor general remark is that this hotel is in need of slight overall refurbishment (thing which was not done when it was rebranded from Sofitel) as many things look tired.
