Despite this point of criticism I would definitely recommend this hotel to those who want to explore Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a great location with excellent staff!”
Reviews.Author: SEETHEBEST
Reviews.Content: I found out about this hotel in a guidebook, and happened to stumble across a very good deal- three nights for the price of two, including breakfast. It is in an excellent location, within minutes of Plaza de Espana, and two Metro stops, as well as a bus stop, with frequent local city buses to many parts of Madrid. Many of the sights, such as the Palacio Real, are within walking distance. The staff were excellent- very polite, friendly, and accomodating, especially the front desk. The room was ready as promised. After reading the reviews on TripAdvisor, I was expecting a small room, but was pleasantly surprised that the size was rather large, with a decent-sized bathroom. It was a "superior room" with two double beds on the fifth floor. The room was quiet and very clean, with turn-down service.The breakfast was very good, with a variety of foods. Wifi was free- just ask for the code from the front desk. The hotel is close to a VIPS and Gino's- good for a meal, as well as other eateries and shops. I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel and would highly recommended. It was one of the reasons my first trip to Madrid was such a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Ectoras_gr
Reviews.Content: On the outside the building is rather dull. As mentioned in reviews before the furnitute especially the cupboards look a bit tired and the carpets though clean, have seen better days. The beds were very soft but that is a personal dislike rather than a citicism. However, the staff at the reception desk are friendly and professional and the check in process is done quickly and efficiently. They are also always ready to answer questions and offer advice- smiling all the time. The rooms are spotless, the bathroom shines, the towels are changed daily and the maids are very polite. Our room was made up every morning while we were at breakfast. The breakfast was better than your avarege chain hotel, as apart from the standard bacon and scambled eggs, they had lots of spanish goodies like tortilla, hamon iberico, local cold cuts salami (chorizo), local cheese a variety of bread, local honey and marmelades. The ladies at breakfast are extra polite. It is on a side street off C/ Princesa, a 3-4 minute walk from Plaza Espana metro station, 5min walk to Gran Via, 10min walk to the Royal Palace etc Directly opposite the entrace there is a small square with fast food joints, spanish food chains like Nebrasca and Cafe y Te and my all time favourite VIPs (a cafe/ bookstore/ supermarket) which is open practically all day. Would I stay here again? Definitely

Reviews.Title: “Good sized rooms in great location”
Reviews.Author: cdn_traveljunkies
Reviews.Content: We were really lucky to stumble on a promotion: stay two nights get the third free. It was a great value. The hotel used to be classified as a Sofitel, but was downgraded to a Mercure (within this family of Accor hotels). It had the feel of a 3 to 4 star quality. Right in the heart of Madrid, this hotel was situated only a minutes walk from the closest metro station. It was an easy 40 min trip from the airport. You can walk anywhere to old town Madrid (Plaza Mayor 25 min), the Prado (45 mintues) and especially the Royal Palace (10 minutes). I thought the location was perfect. The room was very comfortable size for two people. The bed felt plush. The bathroom was a good size and clean. We had our laptop with us, so internet was free. We just had to ask the front desk for the code. If you don't have laptop or iphone etc., there is a small business centre available, but it is very expensive. You're better off finding an internet cafe if needed. Contrary to the other reviews lists, our room was quiet. We were on the 5th floor away from the main stairs/elevator. The only time we heard noise was around 6 am on one of the days where a bunch of drunken party goers were walking along the streen below. It was only one night. Our package included breakfast. There was a variety of food offered, but I wouldn't have paid for it. There are plenty of great food options in Madrid. I would definitely stay here again especially if they had the same promotion.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, spacious but noisy rooms”
Reviews.Author: BarGoe
Reviews.Content: The Mercure is located nearby Plaza de Espana. It is a good location but not in the middle of where it all happens. But Madrid is not that big, so you can reach all touristic attractions by foot. The hotel itself had wonderful rooms: very spacious and beautifully decorated. The bed was very good: big and soft. Unfortunately you can hear a lot of what happens in the neighbouring rooms. Breakfast was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & Good Location”
Reviews.Author: SaldeanTripper
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for just one night. Tucked away near lots of tiny bars & restaurants. The hotel was comfortable and clean & the staff were helpful. It is a short walk away from the Plaza de Espana, and not much further away are the Royal Palaces. Although slightly away from the City centre, I've stayed in this area before and it is very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, lovely experience”
Reviews.Author: tdeepti
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 5 nights at Christmas time, and it was great. The hotel though old, is very charming and elegant. What i liked about the hotel: 1) Location - very close to the metro stop (1 minute walk), and close to several sights of interest including the royal palace - almost walked to all places in the city from here 2) Staff - were very friendly and offered a lot of advice about the place, where we could go, what we could do etc. took good care of us on Christmas eve where there were no restaurants open in the city! 3) Breakfast - we had it included as part of the room and it is a good buffet - sufficient to skip lunch altogether! 4) Rooms - though on the smaller side, were very comfortable and elegant (only nit - some of the paint was peeling on the cupboards, but thats almost nothing!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - Clean and comfortable, but slightly noisy”
Reviews.Author: habs07
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights and at 90 EUR per night it was an extraordinary value. The rooms were of standard size, maybe slightly smaller than usual, but not too small. The hotel and the rooms were spotless and the bed quite comfortable. Only complaint is that you can hear absolutely everything going on in the hotel; however, it was not too much of a problem and considering the cost was less than half of the average competitor, no complaints here. Location was also great, a very short walk (5 minutes or less) to the Plaza de Espana (and even shorter to Ventura Rodriguez) Metro. The free high speed internet was a great perk. All and all a very decent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very standard 4-star hotel, nothing wrong, nothing exceptional”
Reviews.Author: global-traveler86
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite conveniently located for all the tourist attractions, and is just on the border of the old town and tourist areas. There are two convenient metro stops within 5 minutes walk, as well as numerous eating places right outside the hotel. The hotel itself is located off the main street in a quiet area. The rooms and common areas in the hotel have been kept to a high standard, and were very clean and “fresh” when we arrived. Our double room was a bit small, but probably average compared to the typical European hotel room. Bathrooms were clean, and the AC was working very well. There is free wifi in all the rooms and throughout the hotel; just ask the reception desk for a username and password. Breakfast is exorbitant though at 20+ Euros per person, and we did not take it. The reception staffs were nice, but a bit slow when we were checking in and out.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and welcoming hotel in the heart of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: snorbans_family
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located very close to an Underground station with lifts, and within walking distance of nearly everything we wanted to see. On a hot afternoon in a busy city, it was an oasis of cool tranquillity. We arrived, hot and tired after a long journey, and the friendly, English-speaking staff really took good care of us. The rooms were quiet and spotless, the beds comfortable, and the showers quite powerful. The staff gave us a map of the area, pointing out all of the attractions we may want to visit, with approximate walking distances. We felt that the hotel breakfast was expensive, but eating breakfast out in Madrid is very easy; there are lots of places serving it. We would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great but a bit expensive”
Reviews.Author: IdaandKristof
Reviews.Content: Good location on side but just few steps from main streets, King Palace and not far from Prado or 'old town'. Rooms are clean, comfortable. Hotel is quiet and with nice, quiet talking staff. Very special, relaxed environment. Rooms available below 100 euro but very expensive restaurant, underground parking (25 euro per night) and any additional services. I would like to recommend only as good bed, nothing else. Balcony not for using, just a decoration.

Reviews.Title: “Old style hotel with excellent rates”
Reviews.Author: JT14
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here a few times. Short summary is that available rates seem to be very low at times - €100 or even less per night - at which point this is great value. Hotel is slightly shabby but has charm - it is full of original features that are a world away from typical business hotels. It's the sort of place that would have been quite grand 20 years ago. But most important of course is that the beds are really comfortable (crisp linen, lots of soft bedding) - the most luxurious sleep you can get for the price. But the rack rates are €300 or more. It's not worth that.

Reviews.Title: “Quite nice hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: AirlineElite
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Sofitel for just one night. While the hotel does not stand out as a superb luxury hotel, it is of very good standard and provided good value for money spent. The breakfast was a bit expensive, though, considering the selection of items in the buffet. Front desk service was courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: fatboab
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a short City Break and enjoyed our stay in this Hotel. The room we had was very quiet at night with a really comfortable bed which led to a peaceful nights sleep We also had a large balcony with a patio table, chairs and a sunlounger. There is also a safe in the wardrope which we unfortunately only found on our last day when we were packing to leave! The staff were very helpful and the breakfast was good. Drinks from the Hotel bar is a bit pricey but you do get a wee dish of olives and nuts though! The hotel is in a good location for seeing Old Madrid, the Metro Station and also tor the Madrid Vision Bus stops. Would I stay here again - yes, I certainly would.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but could get better, Excellent Location, Great Staff,”
Reviews.Author: ICE-MOH
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for the second time with my wife and young child for 3 nights. The staff is wonderful to say the least. They are very helpful, punctual and polite. The hotel is in a prime location near everything in Madrid. The rooms are decent and the bathroom are large and nice. However, the air conditioners inside the hotel need to be replaced or fixed. The weather was terribly hot and the air conditioner inside our room was like its not there. The hotel, with little rennovations and attention to electrical details could become much nicer. I would stay there again because of its location and because of the quality service offered by the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Jaded, but great location”
Reviews.Author: mrsdime
Reviews.Content: If you want easy access to the sights and sounds of Madrid, a respectable price and a reasonable bed then this is ideal for you. We only had one full day to see all that Madrid had to offer, so chose the hop-on, hop-off tourist bus. There were two stops for that within 5 mins walk of the hotel. It's also an easy walk to Plaza d-Espana (NOT on the Plaza, as the address suggests). You can pick up the metro there. The hotel itself has a really good looking lobby, but the rooms themselves are dated. They are clean and the TV and bed were new, but the decor needs refreshing and is not the ultra-sleek look of many city centre hotels. One thing that stunned me was the cost of breakfast. It was 23.50 euros per person, for a buffet! We decided even before arriving that it was worth a walk to find food, but there are bars which open for breakfast on the doorstep of the hotel. If you want "chain restaurant" fare then there is also Starbucks, MacDonalds and Burger King, as well as some large Spanish chains. There's a VIPs store which is open until 2am. It seems like an average motorway service station, but in the centre of a city! It sells drinks and snacks, as well as souveniers, DVDs and magazines - wierd! The hotel has no restaurant and the bar costs a fortune, but again there is no need to use either. In summary, the hotel was just what we needed for a short stay. Nothing too expensive or flashy, but clean and perfectly located.

Reviews.Title: “Traditional style Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: Shaun L
Reviews.Content: Located just behind the Plaza Espana this is a centrally located hotel for site-seeing the old part of Madrid, the Royal Palace, Gran Via and Casa de Campo areas. Hotel is very old style and could do with some refurbishment in some areas. Room was comfortable, staff friendly and overall premises clean. Didnt do breakfast at the hotel. Instead used Starbucks just around the corner. Metro station is near by or walk to Plaza Espana for a bigger interchange.

Reviews.Title: “just OK as very old fashion for a Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: thebatpat
Reviews.Content: Just OK as the hotel sounds quite old for a Sofitel, and except the bed everything need to be refurbished. In addition, the personnel was just fine but not providing a high level of servce. It is important to notice that the district is not the more luxury and fency. If you stay in Madrid, I would recommend to go for an other hotel, and if you want absolutely to go for Sofitel, go to the Campo de Naciones which is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: felipeordonez
Reviews.Content: I have a "Sofitel Privilège" card and have stayed in (and hold reservations for) a number of Sofitels. Many are outstanding and feature highly in TripAdvisor's league tables, e.g. New York, Montreal. This Sofitel in Madrid is not one of those. Overall, my 4-night stay was disappointing (compared to other Sofitels, that is), although in terms of value for money compared to other 4-star Madrid hotels, it comes out very well. The location is good, just at the western end of Gran Via, very handy for Metro stops, 100m from the Princesa cinema complex, which shows first-release movies in ENGLISH rather than appallingly dubbed into Spanish, which is the norm in Spain. The street is quiet. The building itself won't win any prizes for elegance, but I agree with other posts on this site that praise the ground floor lobby-lounge-bar-breakfast cafe area. The room was adequate in size, just, and decorated in "traditional" style. I greatly prefer the sleek modern Sofitel style. The bathroom was also adequate, no more, and configured in a somewhat awkward way. Do hotel guests really want bidets these days? To me thay are a complete waste of space. The Roger et Gallet toiletries are an excellent touch. What the room lacks is an armchair in which to sit and read; there is a large desk and a chair, but that's not where I would want to read a book or newspaper. Other reviews have commented on the beds: it is true, they are remarkably comfortable. What disappointed me on this stay was the service. The staff are friendly and multilingual, but requests to the front desk or housekeeping sometimes were forgotten or ignored. The night staff seem particularly stretched: for some reason, the fancy flat-screen TV in my room would not turn off at 11.30pm, so I called for assistance. The receptionist said he would come to my room "in 10 minutes" when he finished his shift. At 12.30am I called again, only to discover that this gentleman had "gone home" and his replacement was "not allowed" to leave the front desk. Incredibly, it seems that a 4-star, Sofitel hotel in the middle of Madrid does not provide a night security guard. Moreover, at about 1.30am, there was a knock on my door, which I answered, only to be confronted by a young man who was clearly not a paying guest, and whom I surmised may have been expecting to be paid (not by me) for his nocturnal services . . . he had been sent to the "wrong room". A bit sad really. Next time I'll stay elsewhere, however reluctantly.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, quality business stop-by”
Reviews.Author: FrenchDom
Reviews.Content: This Sofitel is consistent with the Sofitel standard of decor, delicate touches (like the Roger & Gallet products in the bathroom or the chocolate before bedtime) and service. Liked the lounge/bar/breakfast area on the ground floor with windows and natural day light (not always a given in business hotels), the news papers at hand, the fast service at the bar for bocaditos at lunch time or for my espresso in the morning. The doorman is effective and fast to get you a taxi - not a given in European city centers. The room with window on the main street was bright and nice. Front desk service was good too. That was my 4th stay there. A first choice in Madrid although might be better located for a night out at the theatre than for business districts.

Reviews.Title: “overall a good stay”
Reviews.Author: tonia123
Reviews.Content: Not bad at all, hotel small in size for Sofitel standards, helpful staff, close to metro and other amenities, super comfortable bed!! Nothing too exciting but more than ok for a medium priced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great gem”
Reviews.Author: Seven_Continents
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate compared to comparable 4 stars in the area. This hotel is an easy walk from the Ventura Rodriguez metro station and a 5 minute walk from the Plaza de Espana. The area is not sketchy as another poster said, it's quiet at night as there is not a whole lot of activity in the area immediately adjacent to the hotel. There is a Mcdonalds, Burger King, Starbucks, and a few small restaurants within a 5 minute walk. Check in was easy on a Saturday afternoon. The building is full of character and a walk down the staircase showed lots of nice things to look at. My room was cozy but not tiny. The fixtures etc. were fairly new but the wallpaper was coming off at the seams. I couldn't quite figure out if a face lift was needed or the paper hanger did a lousy job. The room was not spanking perfect but I couldn't find anything to complain about. There is no elevator noise as they are outside the room corridor. I had two single beds with no view and it was extremely quiet. There was a smallish LCD TV and the reception was good. It was very clean with the standard 4 star hotel amenities. There was a full shower and bath tub, although there is the usual Euro 1/2 door for the shower which made the width of the shower area quite narrow for us football player shoulder types. The Gran Via becomes H. Princessa and the hotel is like 1 1/2 blocks from where this changeover occurs so you are essentially at the NW end of the Gran Via in 2 blocks. I walked down to the start of the Prado area in about 20 minutes. I didn't try the food and didn't have any issues so I can't rate the hotel service. I didn't see a concierge but did see the front desk staff giving directions and helping guests frequently. The entrance is locked from midnight to 6 AM, the two times I returned during those times someone opened the door right after I buzzed. All in all an excellent balance of cost and location, I'm really happy I didn't pay quadruple for the 5 stars I was originally considering. The Sofitel really is a great property to consider for a tourist in Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: marek1978
Reviews.Content: Good location near Plaza de Espana (300m), small rooms, good breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Good location and most comfortable beds ever!”
Reviews.Author: Sebaty
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel Madrid Plaza de Espana for two nights in December 2007. It was the first time for both of us in Madrid and we were pleased with the easy access to the Sofitel. The immediate environment leaves a little bit to be desired but Gran Via and the metro are both in close walking distance. There are a lot of restaurants and bars nearby but perhaps the best of all was the interior of the room. The beds were by far the best we have enjoyed in a hotel in Europe. The room was spacious, with a nice flat screen TV. Contrary to other reviews, we found the room to be extremely quiet and peaceful, perhaps due to the long hallway from the door to the bed area. We booked room 104 and one of the major pluses was the balcony looking out onto the street. We were disappointed to come back to the hotel around midnight on a Saturday and the bar was closed. Overall, good hotel, friendly staff. Would definitely stay here again and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Above Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: dcp_7
Reviews.Content: This was a good hotel and the only reason I have marked it down is because of the noise and the staff. The front desk was chaotic and when I asked for a taxi it took nearly twenty minutes to get one, as the memeber of staff was constanly interupted by other guests as he was the only one on duty. Not his fault but why were there so few staff on in the morning? Rooms were good as was the bathroom and it was nice to have a balcony. However they were noisey as others have mentioned. Breakfast was average but the staff servicing this were miserable and everything was a terrible effort for them. The breakfast room is open off the lobby and nothing special, made even worse by loud American tourists who thought it was acceptable to let there children run riot, screaming the place down!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: misterrush
Reviews.Content: We booked the Sofitel through Expedia. No problems with the booking. They were expecting us when we turned up. Nice lobby. Comfortable seating. Our room was on the 1st floor. Decent size, soft comfortable bed. Far too many pillows. We requested non-feather pillows upon arrival at the hotel but this could not be provided. No noise pollution at all. The main negative issue with the room was the window which opened out onto a sort of courtyard. It meant there was very little light coming into the room. Not really a problem as we were out all day but would have been nice to draw back the curtains in the morning and get some sunshine coming in. Bathroom was clean. Decent shower. Nice towels. Room service decided to take the 2 used bath towels and replace them with only 1! Soon rectified with a call to reception. The location is great. You can walk to Plaza de Espana in 2 minutes and take the metro anywhere in Madrid. The price with expedia was decent. So overall - a decent hotel for a short visit to Madrid. Good location, comfortable rooms. Make sure to request one with outside window(s).

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: LAjourneyman
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel Madrid Plaza de Espana is in a very nice location (two blocks from the Ventura Rodriguez metro), the staff is extraordinarily friendly and patient (especially since I don't speak Spanish very well), and the beds were very comfortable. If possible, I would recommend requesting a room with a balcony; it really enhances the hotel experience. Although the regular hotel prices are a little expensive (esp given that there is no full restaurant, pool, or fitness center), I was able to get the "hot deal" rate directly from the hotel website which fell right in my price range (100-110 euros).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, location not great”
Reviews.Author: sisgb
Reviews.Content: Booked this through AUCTIONAIR, the charity auction site. It took some finding, and is down a small side street, which is not the most salubrious area. The hotel was lovely, quaint but very smart, comfortable room, and nice touches, like fruit in the room etc. However, we did not manage to eat dinner in the restaurant, because it never seemed to be open! A good base though, not too far from the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Fine choice for business”
Reviews.Author: hnewburn
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three days in early March on business. It did seem to be a more expensive than I thought it was worth, but I don't know if that's true in general for Madrid. The location was very convenient. It's right next to several restaurants, including a pub, a good kebab place and a VIPS (restaurant/ convenience store). The room was comfortable. Like other Sofitel's, it's got the half door on the bath/shower, which does a really bad job of keeping water in. The shower was plenty hot and had good pressure, good sized bathroom with a bidet. The bed was very large and comfortable. 3 English language news channels, plus Eurosport. Some in-room movies, if you're buying Internet, can get all the movies for 5 euros more. Internet connection was fine, wireless was only available with a card that you buy. AC was a little underpowered, but there was a small balcony and the open door worked fine for sleeping cool at night. I'd stay here again, I might look elsewhere for a vacation stay.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel Madrid Plaza de Espana”
Reviews.Author: DebussyParis
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel end of December 2006. The hotel is very nice, staff is friendly. However on the 31st December the hotel bar was closed at 10pm, no room service either. I was very disappointed. I recommend this hotel but not on the 31st of December.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: BritishVirgin
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel four or five times and will return. The first time, I got a room through priceline and had never heard of it before. It has an excellent location, but is down a small street so is not noisy. The staff are always friendly, and the rooms are very nice. The Deluxe Rooms with an outside terrace are probably worth a little bit of extra money. On that first stay the person at reception recommended the restaurant next door, Dantxari, which is a great choice for traditional Basque food. This hotel does not have a restaurant, but sets up a great breakfast buffer every morning. I would recommend it for both tourists and business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “1 Night in Plaza Espana”
Reviews.Author: S&P-Together
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night prior to a flight out. Hotel was clean, room was clean and staff was nice. Bed was comfortable. The bathroom paint and plaster was peeling. Nice size room. Common areas very nicely decorated and clean. Not to sure about the Plaza Espana...a little seedy looking therefore did not explore the area much...prefer the area around the Prado. I have stayed at better Sofitel's.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, with very comfy beds.”
Reviews.Author: Russ-McD
Reviews.Content: We fancied going a bit up-market while on a Motorbike holiday in Spain, and stumbled across the Sofitel. We paid a walk in rate of €171 which they said was a promotion, although I did find out later we probably could have got it on the net for €50 less. The receptionist was very pleasant and professional, and my bargaining resulted in free parking for the night in their secure underground carpark - otherwise this would have cost €24. The rooms, were small, but sumptious, with beautiful marble bathrooms, dressing gowns provided, and a good quality LCD TV, (albeit with only CNN in English). The beds were really comfy with huge pillows. The trouser press may have had its uses, but a coffee pot would have been more practical. We didn't sample the food, so can't comment. Overall I suspect we enjoyed a standard typical of this chain - good, professional service, but nothing that makes it stand out in the marque, especially in the service, or value for money dept. I would stay there again, but I'm sure there are other hotels also of a similar standard.

Reviews.Title: “Briliant Service, one of the best Sofitel Hotels”
Reviews.Author: WillR
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at this Hotel and the Service was fantastic. We were made very welcome and the staff gave lots of help in finding our way around the city. Being a Sofitel Previledge card holder meant that extra bit of service like a welcome drink and fresh fruit in the room. The rooms were spotless and very cmfortable, good size and large bathroom. As usual the beds were a dream to sleep on. The only draw backs were: the room did not have a mini bar or fridge but the bar gave us ice to cool our water, also no tea and coffee making facilities in the room. The breakfast was ample but the staff are constantly clearing your table whilst you're still eating, at one stage i went to get some fresh toast came back and my fresh pot of tea and jams had been cleared. Very annoying. On the whole a very nice hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Give it a chance”
Reviews.Author: lbrccso
Reviews.Content: You might be a little put off by the immediate surroundings, but once inside this is a delightful hotel. An excellent city break base. Excellent and spotless public areas and a generous continental breakfast. Desk staff are very helpful and english speaking ( if not they will find one who is). Rooms are perhaps just a little tired but the size and the refurb'd bathrooms are super. Decent LCD TV ( only CNN in english again!!!!) and all IT mod cons. We had a balcony overlooking the busy street, but the double glazing was super efficient as was the air con. Beds are just like big clouds to float on plus fantastic pillows, so come and be rested. The neighbourhood seems quite safe with buses and the metro all minutes away, plus shops, bars, restaurants, Grand Via, Plaza Mayor and the sites like the Royal Palace in walking distance. Don't be put off by reputation of El Rastro -- just be sensible and take precautions over your valuables and enjoy this huge Sunday market just minutes away from the Centre. Decent restaurant by the Opera House - Il Traviata. Remember it only costs 1 euro to get from the airport to the City by metro or 61.5cents if you buy 10 tickets -- where else in the world?
